description:
go.exp/locale/cldr: added Slice type that provides generic functionality
for operating on slices of Elems.  CLDR often specifies multiple variants
for a single definition.  Package writers may choose to select only a subset
of these definitions.  The operations in Slice provide some generic and common
operations for selecting among a set of alternatives.
Example users are removing all but the default values and select from a
preferred set of alternatives.

messages.text:
Hello r@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.exp/

https://codereview.appspot.com/7712049/diff/8001/locale/cldr/slice.go
File locale/cldr/slice.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7712049/diff/8001/locale/cldr/slice.go#newcode14
locale/cldr/slice.go:14: // It can be wrapped around any slice of which the element type implements Elem.
what does 'implements Elem' mean?

https://codereview.appspot.com/7712049/diff/8001/locale/cldr/slice.go
File locale/cldr/slice.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7712049/diff/8001/locale/cldr/slice.go#newcode14
locale/cldr/slice.go:14: // It can be wrapped around any slice of which the element type implements Elem.
Elem is the interface defined in base.go.  Changed comment to indicate it concerns the interface.

On 2013/03/19 18:11:58, r wrote:
> what does 'implements Elem' mean?

LGTM
cute

https://codereview.appspot.com/7712049/diff/13001/locale/cldr/slice.go
File locale/cldr/slice.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7712049/diff/13001/locale/cldr/slice.go#newcode26
locale/cldr/slice.go:26: // MakeSlice wraps any point to a slice of Elems.
"pointer"?

https://codereview.appspot.com/7712049/diff/13001/locale/cldr/slice.go
File locale/cldr/slice.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7712049/diff/13001/locale/cldr/slice.go#newcode26
locale/cldr/slice.go:26: // MakeSlice wraps any point to a slice of Elems.
On 2013/03/21 19:02:38, r wrote:
> "pointer"?

Done.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=cb21096d9e6f&repo=exp ***

for operating on slices of Elems.  CLDR often specifies multiple variants
for a single definition.  Package writers may choose to select only a subset
of these definitions.  The operations in Slice provide some generic and common
operations for selecting among a set of alternatives.
Example users are removing all but the default values and select from a
preferred set of alternatives.

CC=golang-dev
